item.title: CI/CD Pipeline Design: The Stages
item.description: Building CI/CD pipelines seems to be one of those topics that every team seems to struggle with. There are many effects that contribute to this: CI pipelines are almost always legacy infrastructure, built at a time when both the software and the team were fundamentally smaller and simpler. Being tooling infrastructure, they are never a priority. As a result they are never maintained or adjusted to new needs. For the same reason (not a priority), people almost never invest any significant amount of design in them.
